predictions.text: U.S. CPI-U core (all items less food and energy) year-over-year for August 2025 will be between 3.1% and 3.4%, as reported by BLS on 2025-09-11.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify in the BLS CPI news release for August 2025: the 12-month percent change for the index for all items less food and energy (seasonally unadjusted).
monitoring_signals: Cleveland Fed Inflation Nowcast for core CPI
predictions.rationale: Labor market softening and ongoing core disinflation trends should cap core CPI YoY, with shelter deceleration offsetting services stickiness.

predictions.text: U.S. Retail Sales control group (ex autos, gasoline, building materials, and food services) month-over-month for August 2025 will be between -0.1% and 0.3% in the Census release on 2025-09-17.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify in the Census Advance Monthly Retail Trade report. Compute control group as retail sales excluding motor vehicle & parts dealers, gasoline stations, building materials & garden equipment dealers, and food services & drinking places.
monitoring_signals: Gasoline prices vs. ex-gas control group
predictions.rationale: Consumer momentum is moderating; ex-energy and autos, spending likely flattish to modestly positive.

predictions.text: At the September 17, 2025 FOMC, the SEP median projection for the federal funds rate at end-2025 will be between 4.50% and 5.00% (midpoint terms).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify in the Federal Reserve’s Summary of Economic Projections: the median of participants’ projections for the federal funds rate, end of 2025, reported as the midpoint of the target range.
monitoring_signals: OIS and fed funds futures-implied path
predictions.rationale: Softening labor data argue for lower path, but inflation persistence keeps the median near 4.75% (+/- 25 bp).

predictions.text: From 2025-09-10 close to 2025-09-30 close, Oracle (ORCL) will outperform SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SPY) by at least 4.0 percentage points based on percentage change in adjusted close prices.
predictions.verification_criteria: Calculate percentage change in adjusted close for ORCL and SPY from 2025-09-10 to 2025-09-30. ORCL outperformance must be ≥4.0 percentage points.
monitoring_signals: Cloud/AI order book disclosures and analyst upgrades
Options skew and volume for ORCL
predictions.rationale: Positive earnings surprise and AI/cloud guidance historically sustain short-term relative momentum.

predictions.text: The Cboe Volatility Index (VIX) will close at or above 20.00 on at least one trading day by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via Cboe official VIX historical closing data that VIX close ≥ 20.00 on any session through 2025-10-31.
monitoring_signals: Credit spreads and equity put/call skew
predictions.rationale: Event risk (FOMC, geopolitics, courts) and thin liquidity can trigger a brief vol spike.

predictions.text: USD/CNH (Yahoo Finance: CNH=X) will close at or above 7.45 on at least one trading day by 2025-10-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the daily close for CNH=X on Yahoo Finance (or equivalent reputable data source) reaches ≥ 7.45 by the deadline.
monitoring_signals: PBoC daily USD/CNY fix vs. estimates
China CPI/PPI releases and credit data
Capital flow controls and policy headlines
predictions.rationale: Deflation pressures and policy easing bias in China tend to pressure CNH weaker versus USD.

predictions.text: ICE Brent front-month crude futures will settle at or above $94.00 per barrel on at least one trading day by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via ICE official settlement prices (front-month Brent) that a daily settlement is ≥ $94.00 before the deadline.
predictions.rationale: Geopolitical risk premia and steady demand can lift front-month Brent above $94 intraperiod.

predictions.text: By 2025-10-31, the U.S. Treasury’s OFAC will designate at least one PRC-based individual or entity for fentanyl, precursor chemicals, or related trafficking via a public press release or sanctions list update.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify on OFAC’s ‘Recent Actions’ page or press releases that at least one new SDN listing targets a PRC-based party for fentanyl/precursor trafficking.
monitoring_signals: White House/DEA/State Department statements on fentanyl
Joint actions with DOJ or DHS
predictions.rationale: U.S. pressure on fentanyl supply chains is ongoing; periodic PRC-linked designations are likely.

predictions.text: Copernicus ERA5 global surface air temperature for September 2025 will rank within the top 3 warmest Septembers on record, per the C3S monthly Climate Bulletin released by 2025-10-10.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check the Copernicus Climate Change Service monthly bulletin for September 2025; confirm the rank is top-3 for Septembers in their record.
predictions.rationale: Persistently elevated ocean heat and observed polar amplification support exceptionally warm monthly rankings.

predictions.text: Bitcoin (BTC-USD) will trade at or above $68,000 on at least one day by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via a widely used reference (CoinDesk XBX Index or Coinbase BTC-USD) that the intraday or closing price reaches ≥ $68,000 by the deadline.
monitoring_signals: Spot ETF flows and fund inflows
Crypto exchange volumes and funding rates
predictions.rationale: Institutional re-engagement and positive risk sentiment can drive a test of upper ranges.

predictions.text: By 2025-10-15, the npm/GitHub Advisory Database will publish at least one Critical-severity advisory for a compromised npm package with ≥100,000 weekly downloads at time of disclosure.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify a Critical severity advisory in the npm or GitHub Security Advisories affecting an npm package; confirm weekly downloads ≥100,000 via npm registry statistics near disclosure.
monitoring_signals: Supply chain threat intel (e.g., Snyk, ReversingLabs)
Unusual publish patterns in npm registry
predictions.rationale: Active supply-chain attacks and high npm ecosystem reach make another critical advisory likely.

predictions.text: U.S. initial jobless claims (seasonally adjusted) will be at or above 240,000 for at least one weekly reading reported by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check the U.S. Department of Labor weekly Unemployment Insurance Initial Claims press releases; confirm any reported week has initial claims ≥ 240,000.
predictions.rationale: Downward payroll revisions and slowing activity point to a mild uptick in claims.
